intro: Wissadula heterosperma, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pink flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
